entry.et: Middle English, short for attenden to attend

def.dt: :to pay attention :apply oneself tend to your own affairs tend to our correspondence
:to act as an attendant :serve tended to his wife
:to apply oneself to the care of :watch over tended her sick father
:to have or take charge of as a caretaker or overseer tend the sheep
:to manage the operations of :mind tend the store tend the fire
:to stand by (as a rope) in readiness to prevent mischance (as fouling)

entry.et: Middle English, to stretch, direct oneself, from Anglo-French tendre tender

def.dt: :to move, direct, or develop one's course in a particular direction cannot tell where society is tending
:to exhibit an inclination or tendency :conduce tends to be optimistic
